title: Mass evacuation of Philippine villages underway after a brief but major volcanic eruption
byline: About 87,000 people were being evacuated in a central Philippine region Tuesday a day after a volcano briefly erupted with a towering ash plume and superhot streams of gas and debris hurtling down its western slopes.

title: Do not mislead public on vehicle imports: Minister urges importers
byline: Despite advertisements by vehicle importers claiming that vehicle imports will soon be allowed, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa urged them not to mislead the public with such claims.

title: Congo mystery disease: No screening as yet: Health Ministry
byline: Responding to reports of a mystery disease spreading in Congo affecting children, Sri Lanka has not yet started screening at airports as the threat seems extremely minimal.

title: Viral flu hits children
byline: An influenza-like illness is making the rounds among children in Sri Lanka, causing concern among parents.

title: Low-pressure area to approach Sri Lanka, Tamil Nadu tomorrow
byline: The low pressure area persisting over south-east Bay of Bengal is likely to continue to move west-north-westwards and reach over southwest Bay of Bengal off the Sri Lanka – Tamil Nadu coasts by tomorrow (11), the Meteorological Department said.

title: Maximum wholesale, retail prices for local rice varieties issued
byline: A gazette notification (2414/02) was issued yesterday by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA), specifying the maximum retail and wholesale prices for local rice varieties.

title: Minister Lalkantha, Govt. have to walk the talk: SJB MP
byline: Minister of Agriculture K.D. Lal Kantha should walk the talk and introduce new laws to enable landowners and farmers to take action against animals that destroy crops, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Nalin Bandara Jayamaha said today.

title: Jayasuriya laments batting failures after Sri Lanka’s series defeat to Proteas
byline: Sri Lanka’s dreams of reaching the ICC World Test Championship final have taken a severe hit following a 2-0 series defeat in South Africa.

title: NDF nominates Faizer Mustapha as National List MP
byline: The New Democratic Front (NDF) has submitted the name of Faizer Mustapha as its national list MP, NDF General Secretary Sharmila Perera said.

title: 8 suspects in remand custody over Club Wasantha shooting granted bail
byline: Eight suspects, including the owner of the tattoo shop in Athurugiriya, who had been remanded over the double murder of businessman Surendra Wasantha Perera alias Club Wasantha and another in Aturugiriya on July 08, were ordered to be released on bail by Homagama High Court Judge Mohamed Ishardeen.

title: Over 1,000 Sri Lankan workers set to leave for Israel between Dec 2024-Jan 2025
byline: A total of 1,802 Sri Lankan workers are set to leave for Israel between December 2024 and January 2025, according to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign  Employment.

title: Govt approves plan for use of Visumpaya, Presidential mansions
byline: The government has granted approval to introduce an appropriate system for the utilisation of the bungalow Visumpaya and existing Presidential mansions in various areas under the control of the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government.

title: Govt. approval granted to receive 22 diesel engines from India
byline: The Indian Railways have agreed to provide 22 American Locomotive Company (ALCO) diesel engines to Sri Lanka Railways as a grant from the Indian Government.

title: Dr. Anil Jasinghe appointed as Health Ministry and Mass Media Secretary
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Dr. Anil Jasinghe as the new Secretary to the Ministries of Health and Mass Media.

title: China to provide entire requirement of school uniform fabric for 2025 as grant
byline: China is to provide the entire requirement of school uniform fabric for schoolchildren for the year 2025 as a grant, the Education Ministry said.

title: Ministries to launch sustainable solution to protect crops from wild animals
byline: Measures are underway by the Environment Ministry and the Ministry of Technology and Research to launch a long-term, scientific and sustainable solution to protect crops from being destroyed by wild animals, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa announced.

title: President to visit India on Sunday; set to meet Indian President, PM
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is set to visit India between December 15 and 17 as his maiden state visit, Cabinet spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Speaker to make statement on his doctorate soon: Dr. Jayatissa
byline: Speaker Dr. Ashoka Ranwala will make a statement in a few days regarding various reports on his doctorate, Cabinet spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Suspension of Parate executions extended till March 2025
byline: The Cabinet has approved an extension of the suspension on ’Parate executions’ till March 31 of next year, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Digital driving licenses coming soon
byline: The government has approved the issuing of digital driving licenses to replace the current ones, Cabinet spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Mass evacuation of Philippine villages underway after a brief but major volcanic eruption
byline: About 87,000 people were being evacuated in a central Philippine region Tuesday a day after a volcano briefly erupted with a towering ash plume and superhot streams of gas and debris hurtling down its western slopes.

title: Champion cyclist pleads guilty over wife’s car death
byline: Former world champion cyclist Rohan Dennis has pleaded guilty over a car incident in Australia which killed his wife, fellow Olympian Melissa Hoskins.

title: US imposes sanctions on Kapila Chandrasena, Udayanga Weeratunga
byline: The United States has imposed sanctions and visa restrictions on two Sri Lankans — Kapila Chandrasena, former CEO of SriLankan Airlines and Udayanga Weeratunga, former ambassador to Russia — along with their immediate family members.

title: Speaker’s false Doctoral title is an insult to Parliament as the oldest in Asia: UNP
byline: Asserting that it was verified with Waseda University in Japan that Speaker Ashoka Ranwala has never been a student of it, the UNP yesterday said the fake Doctoral title is an insult on Parliament as the oldest in Asia and nation as a whole.

title: Jaffna MP demands to be called ‘Sir’
byline: A video has surfaced on social media allegedly showing controversial Jaffna MP Archchuna Ramanathan demanding a hospital official to address him as ‘sir’.

title: Easier for govt. to take legal action against Udayanga, Kapila: Dr. Jayatissa
byline: In the wake of United States imposing sanctions and visa restrictions on former CEO of SriLankan Airlines Kapila Chandrasena and former ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga, Cabinet spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today this would make the matters easier for the government to take legal action against them on Airbus and MiG aircraft deals.

title: General Elections: Over 900 fail to submit expense reports
byline: Over 900 candidates who contested the General Elections have failed to submit their income and expenditure reports to the Election Commission, with the deadline ended on December 6.

title: DS Senanayake College introduces first mobile app in digitalisation drive
byline: As part of the schools’ digitalisation programme, a mobile app named ’MyDS’ has been introduced to connect schools, students and parents into a unified system.

title: Discussions begin for preparation of 2025 Budget
byline: The government has initiated preliminary ministerial-level discussions for the preparation of the 2025 Budget under the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: CEA urges Sri Pada visitors to avoid dumping polythene, plastic waste
byline: The Central Environmental Authority (CEA) urges devotees visiting Sri Pada to refrain from disposing of waste, including polythene and plastic, in the area.
